result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles F Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING 3/23/15 IN BR. 38 AT 8:15 A.M.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  
If revoked, DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b and as a condition of Extended supervision.
Failure to pay all will result in entry of a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised:  as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and this voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined. Random urine screens.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Serve 10 months  each count concurrent.   STAYED until review hrg.
AS TO EACH COUNT 75 HOURS COMMUNITY SERVICE At a nonprofit charitable organization.  30 hours (total of 60 hours) to be completed by the six month review date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles F Miller

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearance by Agent Sandy Chapman.  Court ordered condition time stayed until end of probation.
Per clerk, 75 hours community service on EACH COUNT.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 17.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements to the court by counsels and defendant.  Additional statements by:
Jacqueline M; Margaret F.
AS TO EACH COUNT, CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 4 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction, (each count, concurrent)STAYED for review in 6 months (3-23-2015) in Branch 38 at 8:15.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. 
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Mental health assessment and treatment.
-Perform 75 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization, 30 hours (total of 60) to be completed by the 6 month review date.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Filed:
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief and Written explanation of determinate sentence

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Patricia I. Daugherty  for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Jury Trial. Defense proceeds to Plea Hearing.   
AS TO COUNT 1 & 2  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 9-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m. Br. 17.
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine, State's Proposed Jury Instructions, and Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests additional time for possible negotiations. Court addresses Defense request for adjournment. Court notes that if the Defendant wishes to resolve the case with a change of a plea due to negotiations a written notice to be provided to the Court and State by the Defense no later than 8/15/2014 by 5:00 p.m. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial 8/27/2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case is reassigned  to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in Room 313 of the safety building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Paul M Hauer appeared for Hanna R. Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Benjamin Lindsay for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles F Miller
Current: 3027 N 18th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53226 United States  (Effective: 04-02-2014)
Prior: 8750 West National Avenue #632, Milwaukee, WI 53227

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles F Miller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 26.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 04/02/2014 @ 1:00pm
